intro: Bubbia whiteana, commonly known as the White's burr, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its annual growth habit and distinctive, spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a pale greenish-white color, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Bubbia whiteana is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
